intro: Otholobium racemosum, commonly known as the racemose burr bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny pods that contain seeds. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pink or purple, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Otholobium racemosum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
